case_1.name: Adrian Vale
case_1.chief_complaint: High fever, severe calf pain, red eyes
case_1.history_present_illness:
Patient was well until 4 days ago when he developed sudden high fever and chills. 
Reports severe myalgia, especially calves and lower back, making it difficult to walk. 
Eyes noted to be markedly red with tearing. Nausea and dark urine began yesterday. 

History of flood cleanup work after Typhoon Halcyon (Oct 10-12). Patient worked barefoot in 
contaminated floodwater with multiple foot cuts from debris. No mosquito nets or PPE used.
case_1.past_medical_history: No known chronic illnesses. No diabetes or hypertension. No known drug allergies.
case_1.physical_exam:
Temp 39.6C, HR 118, BP 100/60. Ill-appearing, scleral icterus present.
Conjunctival suffusion noted. Marked calf tenderness bilaterally. No rash.
case_1.investigations:
- CBC: WBC 14,200 (neutrophils 80%)
- Creatinine 3.9 mg/dL, BUN 58
- AST/ALT mildly elevated, total bilirubin 3.2 mg/dL
- Urinalysis: protein 2+, blood 1+
- Dengue RDT: Negative
case_1.initial_diagnosis: Suspected leptospirosis with acute kidney injury
case_1.differential: Leptospirosis vs severe dengue vs bacterial sepsis
case_1.treatment:
- IV fluids with close urine output monitoring
- IV ceftriaxone started empirically
- Paracetamol for fever
- Strict input/output charting
case_1.progress_notes:
Day 2: Persistent fever, oliguria noted. Creatinine rising.
Day 3: Developed jaundice and shortness of breath; transferred to ICU.
Day 4: Dialysis arranged; hemodynamics stabilized.
Day 6: Fever improving, urine output better. Planned to continue antibiotics 7 days.

case_2.name: Luz Fernandez
case_2.history_present_illness:
Patient developed high fever 3 days ago with severe myalgia and headache. 
Two days later, noted red eyes and dark urine. Today she became jaundiced and 
reported decreased urine output. 

Participated in flood cleanup for 2 days after typhoon; waded waist-deep in 
contaminated water with open hand and foot wounds.
case_2.past_medical_history: No known chronic illness. Two prior uncomplicated pregnancies.
case_2.physical_exam:
Temp 40.0C, HR 124, BP 90/55. Marked jaundice and conjunctival suffusion.
Diffuse muscle tenderness, especially calves. Mild hepatomegaly.
case_2.investigations:
- CBC: WBC 15,800
- Creatinine 4.6 mg/dL, BUN 76
- Total bilirubin 5.1 mg/dL
- Platelets 130,000
- Dengue NS1: Negative
case_2.differential: Leptospirosis vs viral hepatitis vs severe dengue
case_2.treatment:
- ICU admission
- IV ceftriaxone
- Aggressive IV fluids with electrolyte monitoring
- Nephrology consult for dialysis
case_2.progress_notes:
Day 2: Oliguria persists, started hemodialysis.
Day 3: Fever trending down, jaundice persistent.
Day 5: Urine output improving, creatinine down to 2.8 mg/dL.
Day 7: Transferred out of ICU to ward.
